text: hi I'm Melissa Clark from the dining
section and I want to steal your best
holiday recipe we at the dining section
put out a call to our readers asking
them to send us their best holiday
dessert recipes we got a hundred and
seventy-five submissions I went through
them I tested over a dozen and I came up
with my three favorites and I'm gonna
show you how to make Jessica Hewlett's
grandmother's lemon ricotta cookies and
they are fantastic this is a classic
Italian Christmas cookie but Jessica put
a little spin on it by adding grated
lemon zest to the dough and then some
lemon juice to the glaze so in this
mixer I've already creamed up some
softened butter and some granulated
sugar and now I'm going to add really
good fresh ricotta don't get this stuff
in the supermarket package if you can
find the good fresh stuff it really
makes a difference and I've got vanilla
extract grated lemon zest and some eggs
once that's relatively smooth add flour
salt and some baking soda for the exact
recipe go to nytimes.com slash dining
make sure to save the beater for that
small child in your life or you know
that big child drop tablespoons of the
dough onto a baking sheet and then we're
gonna bake at 350 for 15 minutes
meanwhile you can throw together the
glaze it's super easy so I've got
confectioner sugar right here I'm just
gonna whisk it up a little bit to get
rid of the big lumps and then I'm gonna
whisk in fresh lemon juice melted butter
vanilla extract and a little bit of milk
you want to add the milk slowly because
I don't know how much I'm gonna need I
need it to be just thick enough to
spread but not too thin so that it runs
down the sides of the cookies do you see
how it kind of ribbons there that's what
you're looking for once the cookies are
cool you just want to spoon some of the
icing over them if you want them to be
perfectly round and neat you can chill
the dough and then roll them into little
balls now I have a little surprise for
Jessica she was kind enough to send us
her very best Christmas cookie recipe so
I made them and I thought why don't I
just bring him over to her house and she
can tell me how I did hi Jessica and
Melissa from The Times so they came out
a little messy I don't know I don't know
like if yours looking year than this but
I think they taste pretty good
my grandma's look pretty really really
did she shell the dough she does okay
see cuz that's the thing I was gonna
chill the dough but then I didn't so if
I chilled it oh I could roll out more
perfect balls right okay that's a good
tip here charlie let me know what you
think weed grandma Dorie approve
really how good yay
